subject: Programming
title: What Graphs Are
description: Learn What Graphs Are in one minute.

hook.text: Graphs are dots connected by lines. Simple concept, extraordinary power.

buildup.text: Nodes represent things â€” cities, people, web pages. Edges represent relationships between them.

discovery.text: Social networks, road maps, and the internet itself are all graphs with billions of nodes and edges.

twist.text: Graphs can be directed or undirected, weighted or unweighted. Each variation changes the algorithms you use.

climax.text: If your problem involves relationships between things, there's probably a graph algorithm that solves it.

punchline.text: Connections between things are graphs in disguise.

quiz.question: What do edges in a graph represent?
